BIOGRAPHY.PARAGRAPH1_TAG: Nowadays I am a Researcher at University of Lleida (UdL), working on constraint programming and machine learning algorithms and their applications, while lecturing on Security, Web, Computing and Artificial Intelligence. Previous experiences have included lecturing on Physics and Computer Graphics at the School of New Interactive Technologies - University of Barcelona (ENTI-UB) and working on medical imaging in real-time applications at Galgo Medical and video-analysis software for football (soccer) training at Mediapro, both as a senior software engineer and research engineer.
BIOGRAPHY.PARAGRAPH2_TAG: Previously I received the Bachelor Degree in Computer Science and the Master’s Degree on Open Source from the University of Lleida in 2006 and 2008, respectively. Then I earned my PhD in Computing at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia (UPC) in May 2013, while at the MOVING and ViRVIG research groups. I focused on the simulation and visualization of fluids in real-time, using the Lattice Boltzmann Method in CUDA and OpenGL with full real-time visual effects.
BIOGRAPHY.PARAGRAPH3_TAG: My knowledge is not restricted just to my research, as I am always looking for more, and surely you will find me reading new articles and books on whatever new technologies arise as my research interests range from physically-based animation and rendering to GPU programming, machine learning, artificial intelligence and optimization.

PROFESSIONAL_DESCRIPTION1_TAG: Student support at different services, such as the Sport Service, the Library, or the IT Area.
PROFESSIONAL_DESCRIPTION3_TAG: Development of a 3D application for the visualization of the roman city of Tarraco for a museum exhibition. It was developed in C++ using Qt and OpenGL for MS Windows machines.
PROFESSIONAL_DESCRIPTION4_TAG: Research and development of real-time fluid simulations for my PhD. The main motivation for the project resided in the complexity in existing physical simulations and more specifically fluid simulations, for interactive applications such as video games. The implemented prototypes were developed with C++, OpenMP and CUDA for simulations, OpenGL for interactive visualizations and everything within Qt for user interfaces on Linux systems. During this time, 3 publications were made in national and international conferences, as well as the defense of the thesis in May 2013. Funding from the Agència de Gestió d'Ajuts Universitaris i de Recerca of the Generalitat de Catalunya and the Polytechnic University of Catalonia.
PROFESSIONAL_DESCRIPTION5_TAG: Mediacoach project. My tasks ranged from implementing new features and improving the existing code base to managing new versions of the application. The project was built with C++, C# and Qt for MS Windows environments.

PROFESSIONAL_DESCRIPTION9_TAG: Research in Machine Learning, Constraint Programming and Optimization. Various publications on Combinatorial Testing and Process Mining applications.
